terms.definition: Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted by a provider and accessed via the internet
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to compare revisions and maintain historical records
A chronological record of system activities that provides documentary evidence of the sequence of activities that have affected a specific operation or event
Standard Operating Procedures - detailed written instructions that describe how to perform routine tasks consistently and safely
A deviation from specified requirements, standards, or procedures that must be documented and addressed through corrective actions
A security method that restricts system access to authorized users based on their specific roles and responsibilities within an organization
The ability for multiple users to work on the same document simultaneously with instant updates visible to all participants
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies
The process of locating and accessing specific documents or information from a documentation system or database
A unified system that consolidates all related tools, data, and processes in one location for easier management and access
Internet of Things - a network of physical devices embedded with sensors and software that can collect and exchange data over the internet
The use of software to automatically execute business processes and tasks without manual intervention, improving efficiency and reducing errors
A chronological record of all changes made to a document, including timestamps, authors, and descriptions of modifications
The use of pre-designed document formats to ensure consistency, completeness, and compliance across all documentation
